column4: I there, any one that can help me to find out why my CPU is at 100% under with firefox + monitor ?
There is a bug in monitor, it reads cpu usage, like, 100 times a second, instead of 5 times a second.
Use htop instead, or set it to read much less often
this might not be the only problem for me : same thing with htop :(
and the words I write here appera with 1 or 2 seconds of delay while typing !

Hmm, are you running anything particularly CPU/memory intensive in firefox? I know that there is a memory leak in flash (I once had flash using over 2G of memory, just because I left it running for several hours)
I don't realy know, but i could cope without flash for a start. How to cut that ?
Well, if you aren't running a flash app, that probably isn't your problem.
Does firefox tend to freeze up?
Like, go a darkened often?
yes it does freeze, but not only firefox : it might be more general
not realy darkened, only taking a while to react to commands (click, keyboard...)
Does htop/whatever report that firefox is using 100/99/etc CPU, or does it just report maxed cpu usage?
it says cpu goes from 1 to 90%, so it often overcome with other apps
96% on last peak !
Ok, next time firefox peaks in its usage, run strace -pXXX > straceout.log (Replace XXX with the pid of firefox)
Then, look around in that log file to see if anything obvious is happening.
One other thing: Do you have beagle installed?
I don't know, never heard of beagle
try sudo apt-get remove beagle  Beagle often caused problems with high CPU usage for me\
I have to leave now, but keep asking around, the community is very helpful
